results.title: Shine
results.creator_credit: Scott Hicks, Jane Scott and Momentum Films
results.brief_description: The award winning film “Shine” tells the remarkable story of pianist David Helfgott. As a child prodigy he was expected to have a brilliant career, but a nervous breakdown on the brink of international success meant that he was institutionalised and without access to the instrument which he loved so much. His voyage out of that darkness into a life which became filled with love, is truly inspirational. Noah Taylor and Geoffrey Rush give exceptional performances as Helfgott, while Armin Mueller-Stahl who plays David’s father is outstanding. “Shine” was a triumph internationally for both the Australian film industry and the relaunching of Helfgott’s career. It is also a testament to the courage of human beings facing adversity and overcome it. Geoffrey Rush received an Academy Award for his outstanding performance.

results.title: Sense and sensibility
results.creator_credit: Ang Lee, Lindsay Doran, Columbia Pictures and Mirage Enterprises
results.brief_description: Ang Lee directs this well scripted, acted and beautifully photographed version of Jane Austen’s first novel. Emma Thompson, (who wrote the screenplay), and Kate Winslet are Elinor and Marianne. Elinor uses her head and Marianne is guided by her heart. Both sisters eventually find love but only after the usual complications. A star-studded cast including Hugh Grant and Alan Rickman.

results.title: The Bridges of Madison County
results.creator_credit: Clint Eastwood, Kathleen Kennedy, Malpaso Company and Amblin Entertainment
results.brief_description: Robert Kincaid (Clint Eastwood) is a photographer for National Geographic on assignment shooting the old bridges of Madison County. He meets Francesca Johnson (Meryl Streep), a farm wife whose husband and children have gone away for a week and the two fall in love. Both realise that their love is special but that their lives can only touch for a few short days. Based on the best selling heart warming novel by Robert James Waller.

results.title: Ninja scroll (D)
results.creator_credit: Yoshiaki Kawajiri, Masaki Sawanobori, Haruo Sai, Shigeaki Komatsu, Movic, Toho Kabushiki Kaisha and JVC
results.brief_description: Feudal Japan - a time of danger, intrigue and deception. Jubei is a masterless ninja who travels the land alone, hiring his services to those with gold or a worthy cause. An evil conspiracy is at work to overthrow the Government. Jubei reluctantly joins forces with a mysterious old man and the beautiful but tragic Kagero, in an effort to defeat the Shogun of the dark and his demonic cronies. Not surprisingly this is a struggle that involves huge amounts of action, violence, bloodletting, sex, supernatural powers and transmogrification. The animation is an impressive though slightly incongruous blend of detailed architecture, evocative landscape and highly stylized action figures. It will also interest followers of popular culture. Citizens Award Winner, 1993 Yubari City International Adventure Fantastic Film Festival. PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS ANIMATED FILM HAS AN ‘R’ RATING FOR PERSONS OVER THE AGE OF 18 DUE TO THE EXPLICIT VIOLENT AND SEXUAL NATURE OF ITS CONTENT.

results.title: Duel in the sun
results.creator_credit: King Vidor, David O. Selznick and David O Selznick Productions
results.brief_description: Scott Chavez, hung for the murder of his wife and her lover, sends his daughter to live with land baron Senator McCanles. The senator’s sons are immediately drawn to Pearl and fall under her spell. Brother is pitted against brother in this classic western filled with love, betrayal and murder. Starring Gregory Peck and Jennifer Jones as the ill-fated lovers and an admirable cast including Joseph Cotten, Lionel Barrymore, Herbert Marshall, Lillian Gish, Walter Huston and Charles Bickford.

results.title: Reap the wild wind
results.creator_credit: Cecil B. DeMille and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Shipwreck on the Reef, Shipwreck on the Reef, this was the cry the local shipowners and salvage operators in Key West during the 1840’s awaited. Their business thrived on the cargo of wrecked ships but are all the wrecks caused by nature or man made? Why is it that King Cutler (Raymond Massey) always seemed to be the first on the scene? These and other questions are asked by local ship owner Loxi Claiborne (Paulette Goddard) and others. Meanwhile Loxi’s suitor Captain Jack Stuart (John Wayne) is suspected by the jealous lawyer Steve Tolliver (Ray Milland). Who will win in the romance stakes? The star studded cast includes Robert Preston, Susan Heywood, Charles Bickford, Walter Hampden and Janet Beecher. This Cecil B. DeMille production of piracy, hot-blooded love and huge clipper ships gliding in the mist won an Academy Award for its Special Effects and was based on a Saturday Evening Post story by Thelma Strabel.

results.title: The Man who fell to earth
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Roeg, Barry Spikings, Michael Deeley and British Lion Films
results.brief_description: David Bowie, plays The Stranger. Armed with a British passport, he arrives in New York but is in fact an alien from a dying planet, having studied earth habits from monitoring television. This hairless, sexless creature is eventually caught and handed over to a team of scientists and doctors for research. Nicolas Roeg’s technical brilliance is apparent in this weirdly voyeuristic science fiction fantasy which is at times emeshed in its convoluted plot. Co-starring Buck Henry as a patent lawyer who befriends The Stranger and reaps success from the acquaintance and Rip Torn as Professor Nathan Brycce, determined to discover the truth.

results.title: In the heat of the night
results.creator_credit: Norman Jewison, Walter Mirisch and Mirisch Corporation
results.brief_description: Set in the deep South at the height of the early 60’s racial tension, this superbly crafted murder mystery deserved all five of its Academy Awards. Best actor winner Rod Steiger gives a definitive performance as a small town, red-neck sheriff who finds himself in an uneasy alliance with a black homicide detective from Philadelphia, strikingly portrayed by Sidney Poitier. In the course of investigating the crime, the two strong-willed men must reconcile their inherent prejudice towards each other. The final result is justice and an unlikely but touching mutual respect. Supporting performances by Warren Oates and Lee Grant, an evocative score by Quincy Jones and Haskell Wexler’s vivid cinematography combine to create the stifling aura of a hot summer evening in the South. The Oscar winning script by Stirling Silliphant is based on a novel by John Ball.

results.title: Go fish
results.creator_credit: Rose Troche, Guinevere Turner, KVPI, Islet and Can I Watch Pictures
results.brief_description: Shot in black and white, on a low budget and using a predominantly non-professional cast, Rose Troche’s first feature offers an inside view of lesbian life in the ‘90’s. Max is looking for love, Ely suffers from a long distance relationship and their scheming friends are determined to match them. Navigated by a wistful narration, the film tracks the inter-linked cast of characters from cafes and bookshops to dinner parties, dates and sex. Starring Guinevere Turner, V. S. Brodie, T. Wendy McMillan, Migdalia Melendez and Anastasia Sharp. Screenplay by Rose Troche and Guinevere Turner.

results.title: Cool runnings
results.creator_credit: Jon Turteltaub, Dawn Steel and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: The world was shocked when Jamaica entered the Winter Olympics with a bobsled team. Although they don’t win gold, the four Jamaicans become heroes for their courage and determination to compete with the world’s best. John Candy plays the ex-Olympian, once accused of cheating, who acts as their coach. Based on a true story “Cool Runnings” repeats the ageless Disney film message about following your dreams.
